00024 #define NETMD_POLL_TIMEOUT      1000    /* miliseconds */
00025 #define NETMD_SEND_TIMEOUT      1000
00026 #define NETMD_RECV_TIMEOUT      1000
00027 #define NETMD_RECV_TRIES                30

00029 int min(int a,int b)
00030 {
00031         if (a<b) return a;
00032         return b;
00033 }

00069 void print_hex(unsigned char* buf, size_t size)
00070 {
00071         int i = 0;
00072         int j = 0;
00073         int breakpoint = 0;
00074 
00075         for(;i < size; i++)
00076         {
00077                 printf("%02x ", buf[i]);
00078                 breakpoint++;   
00079                 if(!((i + 1)%16) && i)
00080                 {
00081                         printf("\t\t");
00082                         for(j = ((i+1) - 16); j < ((i+1)/16) * 16; j++)
00083                         {
00084                                 if(buf[j] < 30)
00085                                         printf(".");
00086                                 else
00087                                         printf("%c", buf[j]);
00088                         }
00089                         printf("\n");
00090                         breakpoint = 0;
00091                 }
00092         }
00093         
00094         if(breakpoint == 16)
00095         {
00096                 printf("\n");
00097                 return;
00098         }
00099 
00100         for(; breakpoint < 16; breakpoint++)
00101         {
00102                 printf("   ");
00103         }
00104         printf("\t\t");
00105 
00106         for(j = size - (size%16); j < size; j++)
00107         {
00108                 if(buf[j] < 30)
00109                         printf(".");
00110                 else
00111                         printf("%c", buf[j]);
00112         }
00113         printf("\n");
00114 }

00116 struct netmd_pair const* find_pair(int hex, struct netmd_pair const* array)
00117 {
00118         int i = 0;
00119         for(; array[i].name != NULL; i++)
00120         {
00121                 if(array[i].hex == hex)
00122                         return &array[i];
00123         }
00124 
00125         return &unknown_pair;
00126 }
00127 
00128 /*
00129         polls to see if minidisc wants to send data
00130         
00131         IN      dev                       USB device handle
00132                   buf                     pointer to poll buffer
00133                   tries                 maximum attempts to poll the minidisc
00134                 
00135         Return value
00136         <0      if error
00137         >=0     number of bytes that md wants to send
00138 */
00139 static int netmd_poll(usb_dev_handle *dev, unsigned char *buf, int tries)
00140 {
00141         int i;
00142 
00143         for (i = 0; i < tries; i++) {
00144                 /* send a poll message */
00145                 memset(buf, 0, 4);
00146                 if (usb_control_msg(dev, USB_ENDPOINT_IN | USB_TYPE_VENDOR |
00147                                                                                                 USB_RECIP_INTERFACE, 0x01, 0, 0, buf, 4,
00148                                                                                                 NETMD_POLL_TIMEOUT) < 0) {
00149                         fprintf(stderr, "netmd_poll: usb_control_msg failed\n");
00150                         return NETMDERR_USB;
00151                 }
00152                 if (buf[0] != 0) {
00153                         break;
00154                 }
00155                 if (i > 0) {
00156                         sleep(1);
00157                 }
00158         }       
00159         return buf[2];
00160 }
00161 
00162 /*
00163         exchanges a message with the minidisc
00164         
00165         IN      dev             USB device handle
00166                         buf             pointer to buffer to send
00167                         len             length of data to send
00168         
00169         Returns >0 on success, <0 on failure
00170 */
00171 int netmd_exch_message(usb_dev_handle *dev, unsigned char *cmd, int cmdlen,
00172         unsigned char *rsp)
00173 {
00174         unsigned char   pollbuf[4];
00175         int             len;
00176 
00177         /* poll to see if we can send data */
00178         len = netmd_poll(dev, pollbuf, 1);
00179         if (len != 0) {
00180                 fprintf(stderr, "netmd_exch_message: netmd_poll failed\n");
00181                 return (len > 0) ? NETMDERR_NOTREADY : len;
00182         }       
00183         
00184         /* send data */
00185         if (usb_control_msg(dev, USB_ENDPOINT_OUT | USB_TYPE_VENDOR |
00186                                                                                         USB_RECIP_INTERFACE, 0x80, 0, 0, cmd, cmdlen,
00187                                                                                         NETMD_SEND_TIMEOUT) < 0) {
00188                 fprintf(stderr, "netmd_exch_message: usb_control_msg failed\n");
00189                 return NETMDERR_USB;
00190         }
00191 
00192         do {
00193                 /* poll for data that minidisc wants to send */
00194                 len = netmd_poll(dev, pollbuf, NETMD_RECV_TRIES);
00195                 if (len <= 0) {
00196                         fprintf(stderr, "netmd_exch_message: netmd_poll failed\n");
00197                         return (len == 0) ? NETMDERR_TIMEOUT : len;
00198                 }
00199                 
00200                 /* receive data */
00201                 if (usb_control_msg(dev, USB_ENDPOINT_IN | USB_TYPE_VENDOR |
00202                                                                                                 USB_RECIP_INTERFACE, pollbuf[1], 0, 0, rsp, len,
00203                                                                                                 NETMD_RECV_TIMEOUT) < 0) {
00204                         fprintf(stderr, "netmd_exch_message: usb_control_msg failed\n");
00205                         return NETMDERR_USB;
00206                 }
00207                 /* get response again if player responds with 0x0F.     */
00208         } while (rsp[0] == 0x0F);
00209 
00210         /* return length */
00211         return len;
00212 }

00214 static void waitforsync(usb_dev_handle* dev)
00215 {
00216   char syncmsg[4];
00217   fprintf(stderr,"Waiting for Sync: \n");
00218   do {
00219     usb_control_msg(dev, 0xc1, 0x01, 0, 0, syncmsg, 0x04, 5000);
00220   } while  (memcmp(syncmsg,"\0\0\0\0",4)!=0);
00221 
00222 }

00224 static char* sendcommand(usb_dev_handle* dev, char* str, int len, char* response, int rlen)
00225 {
00226   int i;
00227   int ret;
00228   int size;
00229   char size_request[4];
00230   char* buf;
00231   
00232   waitforsync(dev);
00233   fprintf(stderr,"Sending command: \n"); 
00234   print_hex(str,len);
00235   ret = usb_control_msg(dev, 0x41, 0x80, 0, 0, str, len, 800);
00236   
00237   if(ret < 0)
00238     {
00239       fprintf(stderr, "bad ret code, returning early\n");
00240       return NULL;
00241     }
00242   usb_control_msg(dev, 0xc1, 0x01, 0, 0, size_request, 0x04, 500);
00243   fprintf(stderr,"Recieving response: \n");
00244   print_hex(size_request,4);
00245   size = size_request[2];
00246   if (size<1) {
00247     fprintf(stderr, "Invalid size ignoring\n");
00248     return NULL;
00249   }
00250   buf = malloc(size);
00251   usb_control_msg(dev, 0xc1, 0x81, 0, 0, buf, size, 500);
00252   print_hex(buf,size);
00253   switch(buf[0]) {   // Attempt to map the error codes 
00254   case 0x0f: fprintf(stderr,"Success for record like command"); break;
00255   case 0x0c: fprintf(stderr,"** Unknown Header\n"); break;
00256   case 0x09: fprintf(stderr,"Command Successful\n"); break;
00257   case 0x08: fprintf(stderr,"** Unknown Command\n"); break;
00258   case 0x0a: fprintf(stderr,"** Error on record\n"); break;
00259   default: fprintf(stderr,"*** Unknown return code\n"); break;
00260   }
00261   // Calculate difference to expected response
00262   if (response!=NULL) {
00263     int c=0;
00264     for (i=0;i<min(rlen,size);i++) {
00265       if (response[i]!=buf[i]) c++; 
00266     }
00267     fprintf(stderr, "Differ: %d\n",c); 
00268   }
00269   
00270   return buf; 
00271 }
00272 
00273 struct usb_device* netmd_init()
00274 {
00275         struct usb_bus *bus;
00276         struct usb_device *dev;
00277         int count = 0;
00278 
00279         usb_init();
00280 
00281         usb_find_busses();
00282         usb_find_devices();
00283 
00284         for(bus = usb_busses; bus; bus = bus->next)
00285         {
00286                 for(dev = bus->devices; dev; dev = dev->next) 
00287                 {
00288                         for(count = 0; (known_devices[count].idVendor != 0); count++)
00289                         {
00290                                 if(dev->descriptor.idVendor == known_devices[count].idVendor
00291                                    && dev->descriptor.idProduct == known_devices[count].idProduct)
00292                                 {
00293                                         return dev;
00294                                 }
00295                         }
00296                 }
00297         }
00298 
00299         return 0;
00300 }

00302 usb_dev_handle* netmd_open(struct usb_device* dev)
00303 {
00304         usb_dev_handle* dh = usb_open(dev);
00305 
00306         usb_claim_interface(dh, 0);
00307 
00308         return dh;
00309 }

00311 int netmd_get_devname(usb_dev_handle* dh, unsigned char* buf, int buffsize)
00312 {
00313         if (usb_get_string_simple(dh, 2, buf, buffsize) < 0) {
00314                 fprintf(stderr, "usb_get_string_simple failed, %s (%d)\n", strerror(errno), errno);
00315                 buf[0] = 0;
00316                 return 0;
00317         }       
00318 
00319         return strlen(buf);
00320 }

00322 static int request_disc_title(usb_dev_handle* dev, char* buffer, int size)
00323 {
00324         int ret = -1;
00325         int title_size = 0;
00326         char title_request[0x13] = {0x00, 0x18, 0x06, 0x02, 0x20, 0x18, 0x01, 0x00, 0x00, 0x30, 0x00, 0xa, 0x00, 0xff, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00};
00327         char title[255];
00328 
00329         ret = netmd_exch_message(dev, title_request, 0x13, title);
00330         if(ret < 0)
00331         {
00332                 fprintf(stderr, "request_disc_title: bad ret code, returning early\n");
00333                 return 0;
00334         }
00335         
00336         title_size = ret;
00337         
00338         if(title_size == 0 || title_size == 0x13)
00339                 return -1; /* bail early somethings wrong */
00340 
00341         if(title_size > size)
00342         {
00343                 printf("request_disc_title: title too large for buffer\n");
00344                 return -1;
00345         }
00346                 
00347         memset(buffer, 0, size);
00348         strncpy(buffer, (title + 25), title_size - 25);
00349         /* buffer[size + 1] = 0;   XXX Huh? This is outside the bounds passed in! */
00350 
00351         return title_size - 25;
00352 }

00354 int netmd_request_track_bitrate(usb_dev_handle*dev, int track, unsigned char* data)
00355 {
00356         int ret = 0;
00357         int size = 0;
00358         char request[] = {0x00, 0x18, 0x06, 0x02, 0x20, 0x10, 0x01, 0x00, 0xDD, 0x30, 0x80, 0x07, 0x00, 0xff, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00};
00359         char reply[255];
00360 
00361         request[8] = track;
00362         ret = netmd_exch_message(dev, request, 0x13, reply);
00363         if(ret < 0)
00364         {
00365                 fprintf(stderr, "bad ret code, returning early\n");
00366                 return 0;
00367         }
00368 
00369         size = ret;
00370         
00371         /*      printf("\nBitrate Reply:\n"); */
00372         /*      print_hex(reply, size); */
00373 
00374         *data = reply[size - 2];
00375         return ret;
00376 }

00401 /*  equiv. of 
00402         sprintf(tmp, "%02x", time_request[      time = strtol(tmp, NULL, 10); */
00403 #define BCD_TO_PROPER(x) (((((x) & 0xf0) >> 4) * 10) + ((x) & 0x0f))
00404 
00405 int netmd_request_track_time(usb_dev_handle* dev, int track, struct netmd_track* buffer)
00406 {
00407         int ret = 0;
00408         int size = 0;
00409         char request[] = {0x00, 0x18, 0x06, 0x02, 0x20, 0x10, 0x01, 0x00, 0x01, 0x30, 0x00, 0x01, 0x00, 0xff, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00};
00410         char time_request[255];
00411         
00412         request[8] = track;
00413         ret = netmd_exch_message(dev, request, 0x13, time_request);
00414         if(ret < 0)
00415         {
00416                 fprintf(stderr, "bad ret code, returning early\n");
00417                 return 0;
00418         }
00419 
00420         size = ret;
00421 
00422         buffer->minute = BCD_TO_PROPER(time_request[28]);
00423         buffer->second = BCD_TO_PROPER(time_request[29]);
00424         buffer->tenth = BCD_TO_PROPER(time_request[30]);
00425         buffer->track = track;
00426 
00427         return 1;
00428 }

00430 int netmd_request_title(usb_dev_handle* dev, int track, char* buffer, int size)
00431 {
00432         int ret = -1;
00433         int title_size = 0;
00434         char title_request[0x13] = {0x00, 0x18, 0x06, 0x02, 0x20, 0x18, 0x02, 0x00, 0x00, 0x30, 0x00, 0xa, 0x00, 0xff, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00};
00435         char title[255];
00436 
00437         title_request[8] = track;
00438         ret = netmd_exch_message(dev, title_request, 0x13, title);
00439         if(ret < 0)
00440         {
00441                 fprintf(stderr, "bad ret code, returning early\n");
00442                 return -1;
00443         }
00444 
00445         title_size = ret;
00446 
00447         if(title_size == 0 || title_size == 0x13)
00448                 return -1; /* bail early somethings wrong or no track */
00449 
00450         if(title_size > size)
00451         {
00452                 printf("netmd_request_title: title too large for buffer\n");
00453                 return -1;
00454         }
00455                 
00456         memset(buffer, 0, size);
00457         strncpy(buffer, (title + 25), title_size - 25);
00458         buffer[size + 1] = 0;
00459 
00460         return title_size - 25;
00461 }

00463 int netmd_set_title(usb_dev_handle* dev, int track, char* buffer, int size)
00464 {
00465         int ret = 1;
00466         char *title_request = NULL;
00467         char title_header[21] = {0x00, 0x18, 0x07, 0x02, 0x20, 0x18, 0x02, 0x00, 
00468                                  0x00, 0x30, 0x00, 0x0a, 0x00, 0x50, 0x00, 0x00, 
00469                                  0x0a, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x0d};
00470         char reply[255];
00471 
00472         title_request = malloc(sizeof(char) * (0x15 + size));
00473         memcpy(title_request, title_header, 0x15);
00474         memcpy((title_request + 0x15), buffer, size);
00475 
00476         title_request[8] = track;
00477         title_request[16] = size;
00478         title_request[20] = size;
00479 
00480         ret = netmd_exch_message(dev, title_request, (int)(0x15 + size), reply);
00481         if(ret < 0)
00482         {
00483                 fprintf(stderr, "bad ret code, returning early\n");
00484                 return 0;
00485         }
00486 
00487         free(title_request);
00488         return 1;
00489 }

00491 int netmd_move_track(usb_dev_handle* dev, int start, int finish)
00492 {
00493         int ret = 0;
00494         char request[] = {0x00, 0x18, 0x43, 0xff, 0x00, 0x00, 0x20, 0x10, 0x01, 0x00, 0x04, 0x20, 0x10, 0x01, 0x00, 0x03};
00495         char reply[255];
00496         
00497         request[10] = start;
00498         request[15] = finish;
00499 
00500         ret = netmd_exch_message(dev, request, 16, reply);
00501 
00502         if(ret < 0)
00503         {
00504                 fprintf(stderr, "bad ret code, returning early\n");
00505                 return 0;
00506         }
00507 
00508         return 1;
00509 }

00511 static int get_group_count(usb_dev_handle* devh, minidisc* md)
00512 {
00513 
00514         int disc_size = 0;
00515         int track;
00516         char disc[256];
00517         char *tok = 0;
00518         char *next_tok;
00519         char *semicolon;                /* Pointers to markers in group data */
00520         
00521         int g = 0;
00522 
00523         disc_size = request_disc_title(devh, disc, 256);
00524         md->header_length = disc_size;
00525 
00526         if(disc_size != 0)
00527         {       
00528                 track = strtol(disc, NULL, 10); // returns 0 on 0 or non conversion
00529                 
00530                 tok = disc;
00531                 next_tok = strstr(disc, "//");
00532                 while(0 != next_tok)
00533                 {
00534                         *next_tok = 0;
00535                         next_tok += 2;
00536                         
00537                         semicolon = strchr( tok, ';' );
00538                         if((!track && g == 0) && tok[0] != ';') {
00539                         }
00540                         else
00541                         {
00542                                 if(g == 0) {
00543                                         g++;
00544                                         continue;
00545                                 }
00546                                 
00547                                 /* Terminate string at the semicolon for easier parsing */
00548                         }
00549                         g++;
00550                         tok = next_tok;
00551                         next_tok = strstr(tok, "//");
00552                 }
00553         }
00554 
00555         return (g);
00556 }
00557 
00558 int netmd_set_group_title(usb_dev_handle* dev, minidisc* md, int group, char* title)
00559 {
00560         int size = strlen(title);
00561 
00562         md->groups[group].name = realloc(md->groups[group].name, size + 1);
00563 
00564         if(md->groups[group].name != 0)
00565                 strcpy(md->groups[group].name, title);
00566         else
00567                 return 0;
00568 
00569         netmd_write_disc_header(dev, md);
00570 
00571         return 1;
00572 }
00573 
00574 static void set_group_data(minidisc* md, int group, char* name, int start, int finish) {
00575         md->groups[group].name = strdup( name );
00576         md->groups[group].start = start;
00577         md->groups[group].finish = finish;
00578         return;
00579 }
00580 
00581         /* Sonys code is utter bile. So far we've encountered the following first segments in the disc title:
00582          *
00583          * 0[-n];<title>// - titled disc.
00584          * <title>// - titled disc 
00585          * 0[-n];// - untitled disc
00586          * n{n>0};<group>// - untitled disc, group with one track
00587          * n{n>0}-n2{n2>n>0};group// - untitled disc, group with multiple tracks
00588          * ;group// - untitled disc, group with no tracks
00589          *       
00590          */
00591 
00592 int netmd_initialize_disc_info(usb_dev_handle* devh, minidisc* md)
00593 {
00594         int disc_size = 0;
00595         int track;
00596         char disc[256];
00597         char *tok = 0;
00598         char *next_tok;
00599         char *hyphen, *semicolon;               /* Pointers to markers in group data */
00600         char *name;
00601         
00602         int start, finish;
00603         int g = 0;
00604 
00605         md->group_count = get_group_count(devh, md);
00606 
00607         /* You always have at least one group, the disc title */
00608         if(md->group_count == 0)
00609                 md->group_count++;
00610 
00611 
00612         md->groups = malloc(sizeof(struct netmd_group) * md->group_count);
00613         memset(md->groups, 0, sizeof(struct netmd_group) * md->group_count);
00614         
00615         disc_size = request_disc_title(devh, disc, 256);
00616         printf("Raw title: %s \n", disc);
00617         md->header_length = disc_size;
00618 
00619         if(disc_size != 0)
00620         {       
00621                 track = strtol(disc, NULL, 10); // returns 0 on 0 or non conversion
00622                 
00623                 tok = disc;
00624                 next_tok = strstr(disc, "//");
00625                 while(0 != next_tok)
00626                 {
00627                         *next_tok = 0;
00628                         next_tok += 2;
00629 
00630                         semicolon = strchr( tok, ';' );
00631                         if((!track && g == 0) && tok[0] != ';') {
00632 
00633                                 if(semicolon == NULL) {
00634                                         /* <title>// */
00635                                         name = tok;
00636                                         start = 0;
00637                                         finish = 0;
00638 
00639                                         set_group_data(md, 0, name, start, finish);
00640                                 }
00641                                 else
00642                                 {
00643                                         /* TODO: following code looks buggy: unreachable */
00644                                         if(semicolon == 0) 
00645                                         {
00646                                                 /* ;group// */
00647                                                 name = strdup("<Untitled>");
00648                                                 start = 0;
00649                                                 finish = 0;
00650                                                 set_group_data(md, 0, name, start, finish);
00651                                                 g++;
00652                                                 name = semicolon + 1;
00653                                                 set_group_data(md, g, name, start, finish);
00654                                         }
00655                                         else    
00656                                         {
00657                                                 //0[-n];<title>// 
00658                                                 name = semicolon + 1;
00659                                                 set_group_data(md, 0, name, 0, 0);
00660                                         }
00661                                 }
00662                         }
00663                         else
00664                         {
00665                                 if(g == 0) {
00666                                         name = strdup("<Untitled>");
00667                                         start = 0;
00668                                         finish = 0;
00669                                         set_group_data(md, 0, name, start, finish);
00670                                         
00671                                         g++;
00672                                         continue;
00673                                 }
00674                                 
00675                                 /* Terminate string at the semicolon for easier parsing */
00676                                 name = semicolon + 1;
00677                                 hyphen = strchr( tok, '-' );
00678                                 if( hyphen )
00679                                 {
00680                                         *hyphen = '\0';
00681                                         start = atoi( tok );
00682                                         finish = atoi( hyphen + 1 );
00683                                 }
00684                                 else
00685                                 {
00686                                         start = atoi( tok );
00687                                         finish = start;
00688                                 }
00689                                 
00690                                 if( finish < start )
00691                                 {
00692                                         printf( "Title parse error\n" );
00693                                         return -1;
00694                                 }
00695                                 set_group_data(md, g, name, start, finish);
00696                         }
00697                         g++;
00698                         tok = next_tok;
00699                         next_tok = strstr(tok, "//");
00700                 }
00701         }
00702         return disc_size;
00703 }
00704 
00705 void print_groups(minidisc *md)
00706 {
00707         int i = 0;
00708         for(;i < md->group_count; i++)
00709         {
00710                 printf("Group %i: %s - %i - %i\n", i, md->groups[i].name, md->groups[i].start, md->groups[i].finish);
00711         }
00712         printf("\n");
00713 }
00714 
00715 int netmd_create_group(usb_dev_handle* devh, char* name)
00716 {
00717         int disc_size;
00718         int seperator = 0;
00719         char* disc = malloc(sizeof(char) * 60);
00720         char* new_title = 0;
00721         char* p = 0;
00722         char* request = 0;
00723         char reply[255];
00724         int ret;
00725         char write_req[] = {0x00, 0x18, 0x07, 0x02, 0x20, 0x18, 0x01, 0x00, 0x00, 0x30, 0x00, 0x0a, 0x00, 0x50, 0x00, 0x00};
00726 
00727         disc_size = request_disc_title(devh, disc, 60);
00728 
00729         if(disc_size > 60)
00730         {
00731                 disc = realloc(disc, disc_size);
00732                 disc_size = request_disc_title(devh, disc, 60);         
00733         }
00734 
00735         seperator = strlen(disc);
00736         if(disc[0] != '0')
00737         {
00738                 disc_size += 2;
00739                 seperator += 2;
00740         }
00741 
00742         p = disc + strlen(disc) - 2;
00743         if(strcmp(p, "//") != 0)
00744                 disc_size += 2;
00745 
00746         /* need a ; // and name added */
00747         disc_size += (strlen(name) + 3);
00748         new_title = malloc(disc_size);
00749         
00750         memset(new_title, 0, disc_size);
00751         if(disc[0] != '0')
00752         {
00753                 new_title[0] = '0';
00754                 new_title[1] = ';';
00755         }
00756         strcat(new_title, disc);
00757 
00758         if(strcmp(p, "//") != 0)
00759         {
00760                 strcat(new_title, "//");
00761                 seperator += 2;
00762         }
00763  
00764         new_title[seperator] = ';';
00765 
00766         strcat(new_title, name);
00767         strcat(new_title, "//");
00768 
00769         printf("%s\n", new_title);
00770         
00771         request = malloc(21 + disc_size);
00772         memset(request, 0, 21 + disc_size);
00773 
00774         memcpy(request, write_req, 16);
00775         request[16] = disc_size;
00776         request[20] = disc_size;
00777 
00778         p = request + 21;
00779         memcpy(p, new_title, disc_size);
00780 
00781         ret = netmd_exch_message(devh, request, (int)(0x15 + disc_size), reply);
00782         return ret;
00783 }
00784 
00785 /* move track, then manipulate title string */
00786 int netmd_put_track_in_group(usb_dev_handle* dev, minidisc *md, int track, int group)
00787 {
00788         int i = 0;
00789         int j = 0;
00790         int found = 0;
00791 
00792         printf("netmd_put_track_in_group(dev, %i, %i)\nGroup Count %i\n", track, group, md->group_count);
00793 
00794         if(group >= md->group_count)
00795         {
00796                 return 0;
00797         }
00798 
00799         print_groups(md);
00800 
00801         /* remove track from old group */
00802         for(i = 0; i < md->group_count; i++)
00803         {
00804                 if(i == 0)
00805                 {
00806                         /* if track is before first real group */
00807                         if(md->groups[i+1].start == 0)
00808                         {
00809                                 /* nothing in group  */
00810                                 found = 1;
00811                         }
00812                         if((track + 1) < md->groups[i+1].start)
00813                         {
00814                                 found = 1;
00815                                 for(j = i+1; j < md->group_count; j++)
00816                                 {
00817                                         md->groups[j].start--;
00818                                         if(md->groups[j].finish != 0)
00819                                                 md->groups[j].finish--;
00820                                 }
00821                         }
00822                 }
00823                 else if(md->groups[i].start <= (track + 1) && md->groups[i].finish >= (track + 1))
00824                 {
00825                         found = 1;
00826                         /* decrement start/finish for all following groups */
00827                         for(j = i+1; j < md->group_count; j++)
00828                         {
00829                                 md->groups[j].start--;
00830                                 if(md->groups[j].finish != 0)
00831                                         md->groups[j].finish--;
00832                         }       
00833                 }
00834         }
00835 
00836         /* if track is in between groups */
00837         if(!found)
00838         {
00839                 for(i = 2; i < md->group_count; i++)
00840                 {
00841                         if(md->groups[i].start >= (track+1) && md->groups[i-1].finish <= (track+1))
00842                         {
00843                                 found = 1;
00844                                 /* decrement start/finish for all groups including and after this one */
00845                                 for(j = i; j < md->group_count; j++)
00846                                 {
00847                                         md->groups[j].start--;
00848                                         if(md->groups[j].finish != 0)
00849                                                 md->groups[j].finish--;
00850                                 }       
00851                         }
00852                 }
00853         }
00854 
00855         print_groups(md);
00856 
00857         /* insert track into group range */
00858         if(md->groups[group].finish != 0)
00859         {
00860                 md->groups[group].finish++;
00861         }
00862         else
00863         {
00864                 if(md->groups[group].start == 0)
00865                         md->groups[group].start = track + 1;
00866                 else
00867                         md->groups[group].finish = md->groups[group].start + 1;
00868         }
00869         
00870         /* if not last group */
00871         if((group + 1) < md->group_count)
00872         {
00873                 int j = 0;
00874                 for(j = group + 1; j < md->group_count; j++)
00875                 {
00876                         /* if group is NOT empty */
00877                         if(md->groups[j].start != 0 || md->groups[j].finish != 0)
00878                         {
00879                                 md->groups[j].start++;
00880                                 if(md->groups[j].finish != 0)
00881                                 {       
00882                                         md->groups[j].finish++;
00883                                 }
00884                         }
00885                 }
00886         }
00887 
00888         /* what does it look like now? */
00889         print_groups(md);
00890 
00891         if(md->groups[group].finish != 0)
00892         {
00893                 netmd_move_track(dev, track, md->groups[group].finish - 1);
00894         }
00895         else
00896         {
00897                 if(md->groups[group].start != 0)
00898                         netmd_move_track(dev, track, md->groups[group].start - 1);
00899                 else
00900                         netmd_move_track(dev, track, md->groups[group].start);
00901         }
00902         
00903         return netmd_write_disc_header(dev, md);
00904 }
00905 
00906 int netmd_move_group(usb_dev_handle* dev, minidisc* md, int track, int group)
00907 {
00908         int index = 0;
00909         int i = 0;
00910         int gs = 0;
00911         struct netmd_group store1;
00912         struct netmd_group *p, *p2;
00913         int gt = md->groups[group].start;
00914         int finish = (md->groups[group].finish - md->groups[group].start) + track;
00915         
00916         p = p2 = 0;
00917 
00918         // empty groups can't be in front
00919         if(gt == 0)
00920                 return -1;
00921 
00922         /* loop, moving tracks to new positions */
00923         for(index = track; index <= finish; index++, gt++)
00924         {
00925                 printf("Moving track %i to %i\n", (gt - 1), index);
00926                 netmd_move_track(dev, (gt -1), index);
00927         }
00928         md->groups[group].start = track + 1;
00929         md->groups[group].finish = index;
00930 
00931         /* create a copy of groups */
00932         p = malloc(sizeof(struct netmd_group) * md->group_count);
00933         for(index = 0; index < md->group_count; index++)
00934         {
00935                 p[index].name = malloc(strlen(md->groups[index].name) + 1);
00936                 strcpy(p[index].name, md->groups[index].name);
00937                 p[index].start = md->groups[index].start;
00938                 p[index].finish = md->groups[index].finish;
00939         }
00940 
00941         store1 = p[group];
00942         gs = store1.finish - store1.start + 1; /* how many tracks got moved? */
00943 
00944         /* find group to bump */
00945         if(track < md->groups[group].start)
00946         {
00947                 for(index = 0; index < md->group_count; index++)
00948                 {
00949                         if(md->groups[index].start > track)
00950                         {
00951                                 for(i = group - 1; i >= index; i--)
00952                                 {
00953                                         /* all tracks get moved gs spots */
00954                                         p[i].start += gs;
00955 
00956                                         if(p[i].finish != 0)
00957                                                 p[i].finish += gs;
00958 
00959                                         p[i + 1] = p[i]; /* bump group down the list */
00960                                 }
00961 
00962                                 p[index] = store1;
00963                                 break;
00964                         }
00965                         else
00966                         {
00967                                 if((group + 1) < md->group_count)
00968                                 {
00969                                         for(i = group + 1; i < md->group_count; i++)
00970                                         {
00971                                                 /* all tracks get moved gs spots */
00972                                                 p[i].start -= gs;
00973 
00974                                                 if(p[i].finish != 0)
00975                                                         p[i].finish -= gs;
00976 
00977                                                 p[i - 1] = p[i]; /* bump group down the list */
00978                                         }
00979 
00980                                         p[index] = store1;
00981                                         break;
00982                                 }
00983                         }
00984                 }
00985         }
00986 
00987         /* free all memory, then make our copy the real info */
00988         netmd_clean_disc_info(md);
00989         md->groups = p;
00990 
00991         netmd_write_disc_header(dev, md);
00992         return 0;
00993 }
00994 
00995 int netmd_delete_group(usb_dev_handle* dev, minidisc* md, int group)
00996 {
00997         int index = 0;
00998         struct netmd_group *p;
00999         
01000         /* check if requested group exists */
01001         if((group < 0) || (group > md->group_count))
01002                 return -1;
01003         
01004         /* create a copy of groups below requested group */
01005         p = malloc(sizeof(struct netmd_group) * md->group_count);
01006         for(index = 0; index < group; index++)
01007         {
01008                 p[index].name = strdup(md->groups[index].name);
01009                 p[index].start = md->groups[index].start;
01010                 p[index].finish = md->groups[index].finish;
01011         }
01012         
01013         /* copy groups above requested group */
01014         for(; index < md->group_count-1; index++)
01015         {
01016                 p[index].name = strdup(md->groups[index+1].name);
01017                 p[index].start = md->groups[index+1].start;
01018                 p[index].finish = md->groups[index+1].finish;
01019         }
01020 
01021         /* free all memory, then make our copy the real info */
01022         netmd_clean_disc_info(md);
01023         md->groups = p;
01024         
01025         /* one less group now */
01026         md->group_count--;
01027         
01028         netmd_write_disc_header(dev, md);
01029         return 0;
01030 }
01031 
01032 int netmd_set_track( usb_dev_handle* dev, int track)
01033 {
01034         int ret = 0;
01035         char request[] = {0x00, 0x18, 0x50, 0xff, 0x01, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00};  // Change track
01036         int size;
01037         char buf[255];
01038 
01039         fprintf(stderr,"Selecting track: %d \n",track); 
01040         request[10] = track-1;
01041         ret = netmd_exch_message(dev, request, 11, buf);
01042 
01043         if(ret < 0)
01044         {
01045                 fprintf(stderr, "bad ret code, returning early\n");
01046                 return 0;
01047         }
01048 
01049         size = ret;
01050         if (size<1) {
01051                 fprintf(stderr, "Invalid size\n");
01052                 return -1;
01053         }
01054 
01055         return 1;
01056 }
01057 
01058 #define NETMD_PLAY      0x75
01059 #define NETMD_PAUSE     0x7d
01060 #define NETMD_REWIND    0x49
01061 #define NETMD_FFORWARD  0x39
01062 
01063 static int netmd_playback_control(usb_dev_handle* dev, unsigned char code)
01064 {
01065         int ret = 0;
01066         unsigned char request[] = {0x00, 0x18, 0xc3, 0xff, 0x75, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00};                   // Play
01067         int size;
01068         unsigned char buf[255];
01069         
01070         request[4] = code;
01071         
01072         ret = netmd_exch_message(dev, request, 8, buf);
01073 
01074         size = ret;
01075         if (size<1) {
01076                 fprintf(stderr, "Invalid size\n");
01077                 return -1;
01078         }
01079 
01080         printf( "Reply: " );
01081         print_hex( buf, size );
01082         printf( "\n" );
01083         
01084         return 1;
01085 }
01086 
01087 
01088 int netmd_play( usb_dev_handle *dev )
01089 {
01090 
01091         fprintf(stderr,"Starting playback\n"); 
01092         return netmd_playback_control( dev, NETMD_PLAY );
01093 }
01094 
01095 int netmd_pause( usb_dev_handle *dev )
01096 {
01097 
01098         fprintf(stderr,"Pausing\n"); 
01099         return netmd_playback_control( dev, NETMD_PAUSE );
01100 }
01101 
01102 int netmd_fast_forward( usb_dev_handle *dev )
01103 {
01104 
01105         fprintf(stderr,"Starting fast forward\n"); 
01106         return netmd_playback_control( dev, NETMD_FFORWARD );
01107 }
01108 
01109 int netmd_rewind( usb_dev_handle *dev )
01110 {
01111 
01112         fprintf(stderr,"Starting rewind\n"); 
01113         return netmd_playback_control( dev, NETMD_REWIND );
01114 }
01115 
01116 int netmd_stop(usb_dev_handle* dev)
01117 {
01118         int ret = 0;
01119         char request[] = {0x00, 0x18, 0xc5, 0xff, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00};  // Stop
01120         int size;
01121         char buf[255];
01122         
01123         fprintf(stderr,"Stopping minidisc \n"); 
01124         ret = netmd_exch_message(dev, request, 8, buf);
01125 
01126         if(ret < 0)
01127         {
01128                 fprintf(stderr, "bad ret code, returning early\n");
01129                 return 0;
01130         }
01131 
01132         size = ret;
01133         if (size<1) {
01134                 fprintf(stderr, "Invalid size\n");
01135                 return -1;
01136         }
01137 
01138         return 1;
01139 }
01140 int netmd_write_disc_header(usb_dev_handle* devh, minidisc *md)
01141 {
01142         int i;
01143         int dash = 0;
01144         int ret = 1;
01145         int header_size = 0;
01146         int tmp_size = 0;
01147         char* header = 0;
01148         char* tmp = 0;
01149         char* request = 0;
01150         char write_req[] = {0x00, 0x18, 0x07, 0x02, 0x20, 0x18, 0x01, 0x00, 0x00, 0x30, 0x00, 0x0a, 0x00, 0x50, 0x00, 0x00};
01151         char reply[255];
01152         
01153         /* calculate header length */
01154         for(i = 0; i < md->group_count; i++)
01155         {
01156                 if(md->groups[i].start < 100)
01157                 {
01158                         if(md->groups[i].start < 10)
01159                                 header_size += 1;
01160                         else
01161                                 header_size += 2;
01162                 }
01163                 else
01164                         header_size += 3;
01165 
01166                 if(md->groups[i].finish != 0)
01167                 {
01168                         if(md->groups[i].start < 100)
01169                         {
01170                                 if(md->groups[i].start < 10)
01171                                         header_size += 1;
01172                                 else
01173                                         header_size += 2;
01174                         }
01175                         else
01176                                 header_size += 3;
01177                         
01178                         header_size++; /* room for the - */
01179                 }
01180 
01181                 header_size += 3; /* room for the ; and // tokens */
01182                         header_size += strlen(md->groups[i].name);
01183         }
01184         header_size++;
01185 
01186         /*      printf("New header length - %i (%02x)\n", header_size, header_size); */
01187 
01188         header = malloc(sizeof(char) * header_size);
01189         memset(header, 0, header_size);
01190 
01191         /* now generate the actual header from each group's info */
01192         for(i = 0; i < md->group_count; i++)
01193         {
01194                 dash = 0; /* no dash */
01195                 tmp_size = 0;
01196 
01197                 if(md->groups[i].start < 100)
01198                 {
01199                         if(md->groups[i].start < 10)
01200                                 tmp_size += 1;
01201                         else
01202                                 tmp_size += 2;
01203                 }
01204                 else
01205                         header_size += 3;
01206 
01207                 if(md->groups[i].finish != 0)
01208                 {
01209                         if(md->groups[i].start < 100)
01210                         {
01211                                 if(md->groups[i].start < 10)
01212                                         tmp_size += 1;
01213                                 else
01214                                         tmp_size += 2;
01215                         }
01216                         else
01217                                 tmp_size += 3;
01218 
01219                         dash = 1;
01220                         tmp_size++; /* room for the - */
01221                 }
01222 
01223                 tmp_size += strlen(md->groups[i].name) + 3; /* name length + ; + // + NULL */
01224                         tmp = malloc((tmp_size + 2));
01225                         memset(tmp, 0, tmp_size);
01226 
01227                         /* if group starts at 0 and it isn't the disc name group */
01228                         if(md->groups[i].start == 0 && i != 0)
01229                                 snprintf(tmp, tmp_size, ";%s//", md->groups[i].name);
01230                         else if(dash)
01231                                 snprintf(tmp, tmp_size, "%i-%i;%s//", md->groups[i].start, md->groups[i].finish, md->groups[i].name);
01232                         else
01233                                 snprintf(tmp, tmp_size, "%i;%s//", md->groups[i].start, md->groups[i].name);
01234 
01235                         strcat(header, tmp);
01236                         strcat(header, "/");
01237 
01238                         free(tmp);
01239         }
01240         
01241         request = malloc(header_size + 21);
01242         memset(request, 0, header_size + 21);
01243 
01244         memcpy(request, write_req, 16);
01245         request[16] = (header_size - 1); /* new size - null */
01246         request[20] = md->header_length; /* old size */
01247 
01248         tmp = request + 21;
01249         memcpy(tmp, header, header_size);
01250 
01251         ret = netmd_exch_message(devh, request, (header_size + 20), reply); 
01252         free(request);
01253 
01254         return ret;
01255 }
01256 
01257 
01258 int netmd_write_track(usb_dev_handle* dev, char* szFile)
01259 {
01260         int ret = 0;
01261         int fd = open(szFile, O_RDONLY); /* File descriptor to omg file */
01262         unsigned char *data = malloc(4096); /* Buffer for reading the omg file */
01263         char *p = NULL; /* Pointer to index into data */
01264         char track_number='\0'; /* Will store the track number of the recorded song */
01265         
01266         char begintitle[] = {0x00, 0x18, 0x08, 0x10, 0x18, 0x02, 0x03, 0x00}; /* Some unknown command being send before titling */
01267         
01268         char endrecord[] =  {0x00, 0x18, 0x08, 0x10, 0x18, 0x02, 0x00, 0x00};  /* Some unknown command being send after titling */
01269         char fintoc[] =     {0x00, 0x18, 0x00, 0x08, 0x00, 0x46, 0xf0, 0x03, 
01270                                                  0x01, 0x03, 0x48, 0xff, 0x00, 0x10, 0x01, 0x00, 
01271                                                  0x25, 0x8f, 0xbf, 0x09, 0xa2, 0x2f, 0x35, 0xa3, 
01272                                                  0xdd}; /* Command to finish toc flashing */
01273         char movetoendstartrecord[] = {0x00, 0x18, 0x00, 0x08, 0x00, 0x46, 0xf0, 0x03, 
01274                                                                    0x01, 0x03, 0x28, 0xff, 0x00, 0x01, 0x00, 0x10, 
01275                                                                    0x01, 0xff, 0xff, 0x00, 0x94, 0x02, 0x00, 0x00, 
01276                                                                    0x00, 0x06, 0x00, 0x00, 0x04, 0x98};   /* Record command */
01277         char movetoendresp[] = {0x0f, 0x18, 0x00, 0x08, 0x00, 0x46, 0xf0, 0x03, 
01278                                                         0x01, 0x03, 0x28, 0x00, 0x00, 0x01, 0x00, 0x10, 
01279                                                         0x01, 0x00, 0x11, 0x00, 0x94, 0x02, 0x00, 0x00, 
01280                                                         0x43, 0x8c, 0x00, 0x32, 0xbc, 0x50}; /* The expected response from the record command. */
01281         char header[] =      {0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x3f, 0x00, 
01282                                                   0xd4, 0x4b, 0xdc, 0xaa, 0xef, 0x68, 0x22, 0xe2}; /* Header to be inserted at every 0x3F10 bytes */
01283         //      char debug[]  =      {0x4c, 0x63, 0xa0, 0x20, 0x82, 0xae, 0xab, 0xa1};
01284         char size_request[4];
01285         int data_size_i; /* the size of the data part, later it will be used to point out the last byte in file */
01286         unsigned int size;
01287         char* buf=NULL; /* A buffer for recieving file info */
01288         if(fd < 0)
01289                 return fd;
01290 
01291         if(!data)
01292                 return ENOMEM;
01293 
01294 
01295         /********** Get the size of file ***********/
01296         lseek(fd, 0x56, SEEK_SET); // Read to data size
01297         read(fd,data,4);
01298         data_size_i =0;
01299         data_size_i = data[3];
01300         data_size_i += data[2] << 8; 
01301         data_size_i += data[1] << 16;
01302         data_size_i += data[0] << 24;
01303         
01304         fprintf(stderr,"Size of data: %d\n",data_size_i);
01305         size = (data_size_i/0x3f18)*8+data_size_i+8;           // plus number of data headers
01306         fprintf(stderr,"Size of data w/ headers: %d\n",size);
01307 
01308 
01309         /********** Fill in information in start record command and send ***********/
01310         // not sure if size is 3 of 4 bytes in rec command...
01311         movetoendstartrecord[27]=(size >> 16) & 255;    
01312         movetoendstartrecord[28]=(size >> 8) & 255;
01313         movetoendstartrecord[29]=size & 255;
01314         
01315         buf = sendcommand(dev,movetoendstartrecord,30,movetoendresp,0x1e);
01316         track_number = buf[0x12];
01317         free(buf); // clear the result
01318         
01319         
01320         /********** Prepare to send data ***********/
01321         lseek(fd, 90, SEEK_SET);  /* seek to 8 bytes before leading 8 00's */
01322         data_size_i += 90;        /* data_size_i will now contain position of last byte to be send */
01323         
01324         waitforsync(dev);   /* Wait for 00 00 00 00 from unit.. */
01325 
01326         
01327         /********** Send data ***********/
01328         while(ret >= 0)
01329         {
01330                   int file_pos=0;       /* Position in file */
01331                   int bytes_to_send;    /* The number of bytes that needs to be send in this round */
01332                   
01333                   int __bytes_left;     /* How many bytes are left in the file */
01334                   int __chunk_size;     /* How many bytes are left in the 0x1000 chunk to send */
01335                   int __distance_to_header; /* How far till the next header insert */
01336                   
01337                   file_pos = lseek(fd,0,SEEK_CUR); /* Gets the position in file, might be a nicer way of doing this */
01338                   
01339                   fprintf(stderr,"pos: %d/%d; remain data: %d\n",file_pos,data_size_i,data_size_i-file_pos);
01340                   if (file_pos >= data_size_i) {
01341                     fprintf(stderr,"Done transfering\n");
01342                     free(data);
01343                     break;
01344                   }
01345                   
01346                   __bytes_left = data_size_i-file_pos;
01347                   __chunk_size = min(0x1000,__bytes_left);          
01348                   __distance_to_header = (file_pos-0x5a) % 0x3f10;
01349                   if (__distance_to_header !=0) __distance_to_header = 0x3f10 - __distance_to_header; 
01350                   bytes_to_send = __chunk_size;
01351 
01352                   fprintf(stderr,"Chunksize: %d\n",__chunk_size);
01353                   fprintf(stderr,"distance_to_header: %d\n",__distance_to_header);
01354                   fprintf(stderr,"Bytes left: %d\n",__bytes_left);
01355 
01356                   if (__distance_to_header <= 0x1000) {              /* every 0x3f10 the header should be inserted, with an appropiate key.*/
01357                           fprintf(stderr,"Inserting header\n");
01358 
01359                           if (__chunk_size<0x1000) {                 /* if there is room for header then make room for it.. */
01360                                   __chunk_size += 0x10;              /* Expand __chunk_size */ 
01361                                   bytes_to_send = __chunk_size-0x08; /* Expand bytes_to_send */
01362                           }
01363 
01364                           read(fd,data, __distance_to_header ); /* Errors checking should be added for read function */
01365                           __chunk_size -= __distance_to_header; /* Update chunk size */
01366 
01367                           p = data+__distance_to_header;        /* Change p to point at the position header should be inserted */
01368                           memcpy(p,header,16);
01369                           __bytes_left = min(0x3f00, __bytes_left-__distance_to_header-0x10);
01370                           fprintf (stderr, "bytes left in chunk: %d\n",__bytes_left);
01371                           p[6] = __bytes_left >> 8;      /* Inserts the higher 8 bytes of the length */
01372                           p[7] = __bytes_left & 255;     /* Inserts the lower 8 bytes of the length */
01373                           __chunk_size -= 0x10;          /* Update chunk size (for inserted header */
01374 
01375                           p += 0x10;                     /* p should now point at the beginning of the next data segment */
01376                           lseek(fd,8,SEEK_CUR);          /* Skip the key value in omg file.. Should probably be used for generating the header */
01377                           read(fd,p, __chunk_size);      /* Error checking should be added for read function */
01378                           
01379                   } else { 
01380                           if(0 == read(fd, data, __chunk_size)) { /* read in next chunk */
01381                                   free(data);
01382                                   break;
01383                           } 
01384                   }  
01385                   
01386                   fprintf(stderr,"Sending %d bytes to md\n",bytes_to_send);
01387                   print_hex(data, min(0x4000,bytes_to_send));
01388                   ret = usb_bulk_write(dev,0x02, data, bytes_to_send, 5000);
01389         } /* End while */
01390         
01391         if (ret<0) {
01392           free(data);
01393           return ret;
01394         }
01395 
01396         
01397         /******** End transfer wait for unit ready ********/
01398         fprintf(stderr,"Waiting for Done:\n");
01399         do {
01400                 usb_control_msg(dev, 0xc1, 0x01, 0, 0, size_request, 0x04, 5000);
01401         } while  (memcmp(size_request,"\0\0\0\0",4)==0);
01402         
01403         fprintf(stderr,"Recieving response: \n");
01404         print_hex(size_request,4);
01405         size = size_request[2];
01406         if (size<1) {
01407                 fprintf(stderr, "Invalid size\n");
01408                 return -1;
01409         }
01410         buf = malloc(size);
01411         usb_control_msg(dev, 0xc1, 0x81, 0, 0, buf, size, 500);
01412         print_hex(buf,size);
01413         free(buf);
01414         
01415         /******** Title the transfered song *******/
01416         buf=sendcommand(dev,begintitle,8,NULL,0);
01417         free(buf);
01418 
01419         fprintf(stderr,"Renaming track %d to test\n",track_number);
01420         netmd_set_title(dev,track_number,"test",4);
01421         
01422         buf=sendcommand(dev,endrecord,8,NULL,0); free(buf);
01423 
01424 
01425         /********* End TOC Edit **********/
01426         ret = usb_control_msg(dev, 0x41, 0x80, 0, 0, fintoc, 0x19, 800);
01427         
01428         fprintf(stderr,"Waiting for Done: \n");
01429         do {
01430               usb_control_msg(dev, 0xc1, 0x01, 0, 0, size_request, 0x04, 5000);
01431         } while  (memcmp(size_request,"\0\0\0\0",4)==0);
01432 
01433         return ret;
01434 }

01436 int netmd_delete_track(usb_dev_handle* dev, int track)
01437 {
01438         int ret = 0;
01439         char request[] = {0x00, 0x18, 0x40, 0xff, 0x01, 0x00, 0x20, 0x10, 0x01, 0x00, 0x00};
01440         char reply[255];
01441         
01442         request[10] = track;
01443         ret = netmd_exch_message(dev, request, 11, reply);
01444 
01445         return ret;
01446 }

01448 int netmd_get_current_track(usb_dev_handle* dev) 
01449 {
01450         int ret = 0;
01451         char request[] = {0x00, 0x18, 0x09, 0x80, 0x01, 0x04, 0x30, 0x88, 0x02, 0x00, 0x30, 0x88, 0x05, 0x00, 0x30, 0x00, 0x03, 0x00, 0x30, 0x00, 0x02, 0x00, 0xff, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00};
01452         
01453         int track = 0;
01454         
01455         char buf[255];
01456         
01457         ret = netmd_exch_message(dev, request, 28, buf);
01458 
01459         track = buf[36];
01460 
01461         return track;
01462         
01463 }

01465 float netmd_get_playback_position(usb_dev_handle* dev)
01466 {
01467         int ret = 0;
01468         char request[] = {0x00, 0x18, 0x09, 0x80, 0x01, 0x04, 0x30, 0x88, 0x02, 0x00, 0x30, 0x88, 0x05, 0x00, 0x30, 0x00, 0x03, 0x00, 0x30, 0x00, 0x02, 0x00, 0xff, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00};
01469         
01470         float position = 0.0f;
01471         
01472         int minutes = 0;
01473         int seconds = 0;
01474         int hundreds = 0;
01475         
01476         char buf[255];
01477         
01478         ret = netmd_exch_message(dev, request, 28, buf);
01479 
01480         minutes = BCD_TO_PROPER(buf[38]);
01481         seconds = BCD_TO_PROPER(buf[39]);
01482         hundreds = BCD_TO_PROPER(buf[40]);
01483 
01484         position = (minutes * 60) + seconds + ((float)hundreds / 100);
01485 
01486         if(position > 0) 
01487         {
01488                 return position;
01489         } else {
01490                 return 0;
01491         }
01492 }

01494 void netmd_clean_disc_info(minidisc *md)
01495 {
01496         int i = 0;
01497         for(; i < md->group_count; i++)
01498         {
01499                 free(md->groups[i].name);
01500                 md->groups[i].name = 0;
01501         }
01502 
01503         free(md->groups);
01504         
01505         md->groups = 0;
01506 }

01508 void netmd_clean(usb_dev_handle* dev)
01509 {
01510         usb_release_interface(dev, 0);
01511         usb_close(dev);
01512 }
